snippet: Andre Anderson, who was hired in July, is leaving Ferguson, Mo., about two months earlier than expected, citing a desire to return to his family in Arizona, city officials said.
abstract: City officials in Ferguson, Mo, announce early resignation of Andre Anderson from his position as interim police chief, citing family reasons; Anderson took six-month position in July following scrutiny of city's police force following 2014 shooting of unarmed black man Michael Brown.
lead_paragraph: Andre Anderson, who was hired in July, is leaving Ferguson, Mo., about two months earlier than expected, citing a desire to return to his family in Arizona, city officials said.

headline.main: Interim Chief in Ferguson Is Leaving His Post Early
headline.print_headline: Interim Chief in Ferguson Is Leaving His Post Early
